Hello sampsa. You first need to download a bittorrent client, I would recommend azureus (http://azureus.sf.net). Then download the torrent file for whatever you want to download (Civilization, in this case...). Launch azureus and tell it open the .torrent file, after that, you should be good to go.

As for anyone wondering how to get around the insert CD thing, you could try mounting the disk image with Toast first, that always works for me. If you don't have toast...well I'm sure you'll find a torrent for it on here somewhere :)

To work around the "insert cd" problem, all you have to do is

open Disk Utility

click on "New Image"

in the "Save As" field type " Civilization III "
(no quotes)

for Image Size, select the lowest (or 5MB)

No encryption & it doesn't matter what read/write
choices you make.

Then mount the image, and there you go.

(This works with Tiger, I'm not sure if Panther is the same).
